description.narrative: Project contributes to: (i) community priorities/needs better met through inclusive and responsive service delivery, improved access to justice, and increased local development opportunities that promote social cohesion; and (ii) women empowerment

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Indicator 1.1.1: Number of supported townships which meet set criteria to perform participatory planning effectively (functionality index) Indicator 1.1.2: Number of supported townships in which at least five social accountability mechanisms are used. Indicator 1.1.3: Number of supported townships where projects meet minimum benchmarks as per Procurement Guidelines. Indicator 1.1.4: % of parliamentary committee reports on policy inquiries with recommendations that receive government response. Indicator 1.1.5: % of parliamentary committee inquiries that integrate gender and diversity analysis (different degree of compliance - partial vs. full integration into all stages of inquiry process). Indicator 1.1.6: Level to which the Hluttaw manages plenary and committee documents electronically and publishing these documents on their websites Indicator 1.1.7: Number of MPs applying a systematic approach in representing constituents in an inclusive manner Indicator 1.2.1: Number of government officials trained by UNDP on rule of law, GBV and human rights Indicator 1.2.2: % of men and women trained who show an increased understanding of RoL, SGBV, gender equality and women’s rights, and barriers to women’s access to justice Indicator 1.2.3: Number of women, girls, and other vulnerable individuals benefiting from legal information, counselling and/or representation Indicator 1.2.4: Number of actions/initiatives jointly developed by communities and local government actors to address women’s justice issues and women rights Indicator 1.2.5: Number of government / land administration bodies strengthened to deal with housing, land and property cases Indicator 1.3.1: % of community members reporting increased trust between ethnic groups after the introduction of inter-village/village tract activities Indicator 1.3.2: % of targeted stakeholders reporting increasing in awareness on conflict sensitivity and peacebuilding Indicator 1.3.3: % of community-led cohesion projects implement

comment.narrative: Baseline 1.1.1: All supported townships start at Level 1 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.2: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.3: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.4: No policy inquiries completed (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.5: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.6: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.1.7: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.1: 95 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.2: N/A (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.3: 200 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.4: 2 (April 2019) Baseline 1.2.5: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.1: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.2: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.3: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.3.4: 0 (April 2019) Baseline 1.4.1: N/A (April 2019) Baseline 1.4.2: N/A (April 2019)

Planned Target 1.1.1: Out of 7 townships (Pauktaw, Ponnagyun, Ramree , Man aung, Taungup, Gwa and Thandwe) all 7 townships met set criteria to perform participatory planning effectively, level 4 across 4 function (March 2021) Planned Target 1.1.2: Out of 7 supported townships, 4 townships ( Ponnagyun, Taungup, Thandwe and Gwa) met for using at least five social accountability mechanisms effectively (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.3: Out of 7 supported townships, 3 townships ( Pauktaw, Maun Aung and Gwa) fully comply with set criteria, met minimum benchmarks as per Procurement Guidelines(March 2021) Planned Target 1.1.4: 20 % of all completed policy inquiries in Rakhine State, receiving response from state government before Coup but after the coup, to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue. Planned Target 1.1.5: met planned respective 20 % of policy and bill inquiries in Rakhine State, Partial integration in 10% and full integration in 20% (March 2021), to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue. Planned Target 1.1.6: to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue. Planned Target 1.1.7: to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue Planned Target 1.2.1: to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue. Planned Target 1.2.2: 65% of men and women trained who show an increased understanding of RoL, SGBV, gender equality and women’s rights, and barriers to women’s access to justice (March 2021) Planned Target 1.2.3: total 6,000 of women, girls, and other vulnerable individuals benefiting from legal information, counselling and/or representation (March 2021) [cumulative] Planned Target 1.2.4: to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue Planned Target 1.2.5: to comply with UN engagement principle post-coup, activities under this output could no longer continue Planned Target 1.4.1: more than 10,000 persons accessing new infrastructure, disaggregated by gender. (March 2021) [direct +indirect] Planned Target 1.4.2: more than 6,000 of beneficiaries in target communities reporting increased household income after receiving program support (March 2021) [direct +indirect]

Planned Target 1.1.1: Out of 5 townships all 5 townships meet (level 4 across 4 function (March 2021) Planned Target 1.1.2: Out of 5 supported townships, 4 use at least five social accountability mechanisms effectively (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.3: Out of 5 supported townships, 3 fully comply with set criteria (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.4: of all completed policy inquiries in Rakhine State, 20% (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.5: of policy and bill inquiries in Rakhine State, Partial integration in 10% and full integration in 20% (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.6: Level 2: Intranet working and modules for plenary and committee systems launched (March 2021); Planned Target 1.1.7: Level 2: Constituency work professional development is delivered to MPs, introducing use of official data and a case management approach to constituency work (March 2021) Planned Target 1.2.1: 130 (March 2021) [cumulative] Planned Target 1.2.2: 65% (March 2021) Planned Target 1.2.3: 6,000 (March 2021) [cumulative] Planned Target 1.2.4: 6 (March 2021) [cumulative] Planned Target 1.2.5: 4 (March 2021) [cumulative] Planned Target 1.3.1: 50% for March 2022 Planned Target 1.3.2: 60% for March 2022 Planned Target 1.3.3: 75% for March 2022 Planned Target 1.3.4: 10 for March 2022 Planned Target 1.4.1: 10,000 (March 2021) [direct +indirect] Planned Target 1.4.2: 6,000 (March 2021) [direct +indirect]
